column4: when I upgraded to 8.04, I overwrite all my video card config files, so now I have no 3d support. is there anyway I can get them back?
mecha25: no. I'm screwed aren't I?
you are human, so yes you are by default. no matter what
I have all the restricted drivers and such, but I overwrote my xorg.conf and a bunch of other files when I updated
do you have a GUI? e.g. is it using VESA or fglrx?
or is X barfing when you try to start it?
gnome is working fine, using fglrx
a while ago you told me to run glxinfo, and it says "Segmentation fault"
bad fglrx install. how did you install the drivers exactly?
I don't remember, it was over a year ago.
will they install if I install all the updates?
no clue but you can install it explicitly right now
